abstract: Harry Hurt III tries his luck at being a stand-up comedian in a bear market.
snippet: Harry Hurt III tries his luck at being a stand-up comedian in a bear market.
lead_paragraph: SO this bear market-bankrupted guy who happens to be yours truly wants to try his luck at being a stand-up comedian. I put on a custom-made suit, and walk into a club called the Comic Strip Live, 1568 Second Avenue in Manhattan, same place where big-timers like Jerry Seinfeld, Eddie Murphy and Chris Rock started out. The joint can hold more than 180 people, but it’s a little after 8 p.m. on a Wednesday night in early October, and the main room’s got maybe 50, 60 customers.

headline.main: A Columnist Walks Into a Bar ...
headline.print_headline: A Columnist Walks Into a Bar ...
